Founded in 2007, Visionect is the premier designer and developer of ultra-low-power digital display solutions created on electronic paper technology. Visionectâ€™s mission is to empower people in public spaces to make better decisions by delivering more relevant, timely information, supported by digital displays easily installed in locations impossible before. The company is known for its JOAN room scheduler and the Place & Play product line, while partnerships with leading industry players have resulted in cutting-edge signage technology for traffic and public transportation, retail, hospitality, healthcare, education, finance, and more.   Full-stack digital & web expert Visionect, the premier designer and developer of ultra-low-power digital display solutions that are changing the way information is being delivered, is looking for a full-stack digital and web expert to manage our web-based properties. Your role: As a full-stack digital and web expert, you will design, develop and maintain web-based properties across a number of brands. Programming skills are essential; ideal candidates will have experience working in custom coded lead-generation websites, including WordPress.  We are offering:  Employment in our Ljubljana HQ. If youâ€™re the right person for the job, we will help you with your relocation. Competitive pay and compensation, with full medical insurance and paid leave. A creative environment, freedom to think and explore, and to advance new ideas and thoughts. Top talent and probably the strongest coffee anywhere.  Your responsibilities will include:  Working with the marketing department to help design and create websites that are easily accessible to consumers while maintaining branding standards and keeping with SEO best practices. Reporting, troubleshooting, and fixing website bugs. You may also manage additional web development team members as the team expands. Spending 50% of your time on hands-on execution and development of web properties, 40% maintaining and improving existing sites, and 10% on miscellaneous tasks. Working daily to accomplish marketing and communications goals and objectives by coordinating activities and events. Developing, executing and overseeing all creative elements, including digital, print and web. Managing the visual representation of multiple Visionect brands through digital assets. Ensuring that all content is presented in an appealing and clear way that encourages engagement. Occasionally working with third party agencies. Overseeing the incoming project flow and help projects move forward in order to meet deadlines.  Skills, attributes and experience required:  More than 3 years of relevant professional experience in the interactive, creative or design field. Previous digital agency experience a plus. Entrepreneurial spirit and mindset, paired with a great work ethic. An "everyone answers the phone" approach to teamwork and being a teammate are a must. WordPress Development experience (understanding of WordPress APIs, and Plugins) Full understanding of web standards such as HTML5 and Schema.org. Excellent CSS Fundamentals. Excellent JavaScript, experience with frameworks like AngularJS or React. Excellent PHP Fundamentals, experience with implementing new features and applications from scratch utilizing PHP Frameworks. Functional Photoshop and basic image manipulation skills. Strong experience with Responsive Design. Comprehensive knowledge of UX/UI design and ability to work well with an internal design team. Fluency in SEO techniques and tools. Strong understanding of digital marketing techniques and best practices. Ability to adapt and change in a fast-paced environment.   Send your applications to jobs@visionect.com and include a CV. VacancyPost: Pisec spletnih vsebin v francoskem jeziku (Content writer)
Content: If you would like to be part of a fast-growing European startup and embark in the journey of international and local content creation to support the SEO efforts, we welcome you to our team.  Weâ€™ve developed a team of international people, with different backgrounds and experiences. We have one available spot for a person who is eager to put into practice the knowledge and language skills in English and your native language.   As a content creator at Eurosender, you will be the main responsible for writing content in your native language. Founded in 2007, Visionect is the premier designer and developer of ultra-low-power digital display solutions created on electronic paper technology. Visionectâ€™s mission is to empower people in public spaces to make better decisions by delivering more relevant, timely information, supported by digital displays easily installed in locations impossible before. The company is known for its JOAN room scheduler and the Place & Play product line, while partnerships with leading industry players have resulted in cutting-edge signage technology for traffic and public transportation, retail, hospitality, healthcare, education, finance, and more.  Systems Engineer (Containers / Kubernetes) Visionect, the premier designer and developer of ultra-low-power digital display solutions created on electronic paper technology, is looking for a Linux systems engineer. Your role: As a systems engineer you will help us deploy, manage and monitor internal systems and the external services infrastructure. You will help us build the next generation of services as well as upgrade and migrate our existing systems to a more container-centric approach. You will deploy our Python and Go based services via Docker and Kubernetes on Google Cloud Platform.  What is it like to work in engineering at Visionect:  Youâ€™ll use modern and interesting technologies. Weâ€™re known for moving with new technologies if they perform better than the legacy stuff. The best part about this is that we listen to your suggestions on what to change â€“ weâ€™ve done some drastic changes this way (like rewritten complete Visionect Software Suite in Go after one of the team members suggested this)./ Our technology stack includes: Python/Django, Go, React/Javascript, GCP, PostgreSQL, Influx, Grafana, Prometheus, Ansible.  Youâ€™ll work in a great team. We tend to hire good team players that go out of their ways to help others on the team. This might be just a one-off problem that you need help with or a full-on mentorship programme that will help you develop your skills in those blind spots. Youâ€™re empowered. Weâ€™re a small team, building a fully vertically integrated solution on the scale of Apple (from hardware circuit to server admin web-app). We would not have gotten so far if we didnâ€™t empower the team to act and take ownership of projects and products. Your work will have impact and scale. We deploy huge numbers of devices yearly across the world (primarily US and EU). Whatever you do will be felt by thousands of customers the next day. A simple optimization can improve customers satisfaction in a most tangible way: we regularly get customer sending emails congratulating the team on improvements deployed. Youâ€™ll grow. We make sure youâ€™re on track to grow every year with regular 1:1 reviews. Youâ€™ll set your goals and weâ€™ll help you achieve them through internal coachings, mentorships, tech talks. And itâ€™s not just tech â€“ we have a vibrant community of sports enthusiasts that work together to achieve their personal goals.   Your responsibilities will include:  Daily operations: Deploying, management and monitoring of servers and services. Improving internal processes: Adding automation wherever sensible, making sure weâ€™re not wasting time on mindless drone tasks while at the same time improving QA. Support to developers: Working with developers and providing them with support during development as well as guidance on how to improve (aka "SRE embed"). Architectural work: weâ€™re building the next generation of our infrastructure and your input will be needed to help us decide the direction to go in.   Skills, attributes and experience required:  Knowledge of Linux/*nix system administration. Programming experience. Experience with modern DevOps practices (server orchestration, configuration management, automated deploys, monitoring, â€¦ ). Experience with containers (Docker). Experience with IaaS providers (youâ€™ve deployed services on AWS, Azure or similar). Experience with good security practices. Good programming skills are a big plus (especially if youâ€™re versed in Python or Go Lang). Proper infrastructure experience is a big plus â€“ youâ€™ve deployed a global service with more than just a handful of users in production. Network communication security on the level of networking protocols is a big plus â€“ you would know how to protect a custom. networking protocol running on top of TCP/IP against various attacks. Kubernetes experience is welcome â€“ especially if youâ€™ve run K8S in production. Google Cloud Platform experience is a big plus.   Send your applications to jobs@visionect.com and include a CV. VacancyPost: Zaposlovanje podpornega osebja za misijo ocenjevanja volitev v Sloveniji
Firm: OSCE, Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights
Content: Recruitment of Support Staff for the Election Assessment Mission to Slovenia The OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) is the leading agency in Europe in the field of election observation. The Office co-ordinates and organizes the deployment of numerous observation missions, with thousands of observers, every year to assess the compliance of elections in OSCE participating States with OSCE commitments and other international obligations and standards for democratic elections, and with national legislation. ODIHRâ€™s unique methodology provides in-depth insights into all elements of an electoral process, allowing the Office to offer concrete recommendations to further improve electoral processes. Further details about ODIHR can be found at www.osce.org/odihr Following an official invitation from the authorities of Slovenia, ODIHR is deploying an Election Assessment Mission (EAM) for the upcoming parliamentary elections scheduled for 3 June 2018. In this respect, ODIHR is looking to recruit support staff in Ljubljana.  For more information about the available positions, duration of employment and application procedure please visit the OSCE/ODIHR website under the following link: https://www.osce.org/odihr/378268             Zaposlovanje podpornega osebja za misijo ocenjevanja volitev v Sloveniji Urad OVSE za demokratiÄne institucije in Älovekove pravice (ODIHR) je vodilna Evropska agencija za opazovanje volitev. ODIHR-jeva edinstvena metodologija omogoÄa poglobljen vpogled v vse elemente volilnega procesa, kar uradu omogoÄa, da nudi konkretne predloge za nadaljno izboljÅ¡avo volilnih procesov. Slovenije sproÅ¾a misijo za oceno volitev za prihajajoÄe volitve predvidene za 3. Junij 2018. V ta namen ODIHR iÅ¡Äe podporno osebje v Ljubljani. Za nadaljnje informacije v zvezi z razpoloÅ¾ljivimi poloÅ¾aji, Äasom trajanja zaposlitve ter pristopnimi pogoji obiÅ¡Äite OVSE/ODIHR spletno stran na povezavi: https://www.osce.org/odihr/378268
